website_summaries.verdict: Perhaps the best thing about the Vespula V2 is its swappable surface to meet your gaming needs; the dense cloth side provides more precision, while the hard polycarbonate side gives your mouse more glide as needed.
pros: Dual hard and cloth mouse pad
Comfortable foam wrist rest for maximum support
cons: Although this is a fantastic mouse pad for extended gaming sessions, the Vespula V2 is fairly pricy

customer_reviews.title: It's a good mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mouse pad, I love it. Almost didn't buy it because of the bad reviews. I can safely say I'm glad I decided to get it anyway! The wrist support is very firm so it is slightly uncomfortable, But I think it will be better with time. I will update this if I have anything bad happen. But so far I completely love it! Edit: The wrist rest is already better, It's perfect. I think this is the best mouse pad I ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Vance

customer_reviews.title: I had the older Razer Vespula for years and appreciated ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the older Razer Vespula for years and appreciated the hard surfaces. This new one has far less "flare" which I appreciate, but all the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: large surface use
customer_reviews.text: I have used a vespula mouse pad for about 4 years now. This redesign is much better than the previous version. It provides a larger surface area, the wrist wrest is much improved being wider and more comfortable, and the construction is better. This is my mouse pad of choice as the ability to switch surfaces between a smooth/speed or rough/control by simply flipping the mouse pad over suits my purposes well depending on what I'm doing. If you are already using a razer mouse, get this pad. Selecting the surface you generally use in the Razer synapse software really allows the tracking of your mouse to operate at a different level.
customer_reviews.author: rothchilds

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't disappointed, but I returned it anyway.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Comfortable wrist wrest (after a short break-in period) Good tracking and feel to both sides Nice aesthetic Cons: Too small for ideal low DPI use CONSTANTLY shifting out of place - the mouse pad goes on top of a thin rubber mat that is attached to the wrist wrest The cloth side feels like it will begin to peel in due time (it's super thin too) Overpriced If the mouse pad and rubber mat weren't CONSTANTLY shifting around during regular use I would have kept it. For the price Razer could have done something more "clever". For now I'm more content with a classic cloth mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Kynes

customer_reviews.title: Already having issues with the felt side
customer_reviews.text: As I feared, the felt side is cheaply made. I've had this for a little over a month and wouldn't even describe what I'm doing as heavy use and it is already showing signs of wear. Divots have already formed in the felt in certain areas and I'm really not sure why. The foam rest isn't the most comfortable in an fps or if your armrest is not well above the initial resting point. Could be they did not test for use without it but this seems unlikely. The foam should be about half as thick with the same give and this product would be perfect as I believe this would save the longevity of the felt side as well.
customer_reviews.author: Austin K.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I like how it can be flipped but that’s the major flaw of this product. The pad sometimes(if not subtlety always) will shift during FPS gameplay(an I’m light handed on my mouse, heavy handers actually have a worse time) and during normal web browsing you’ll notice the pad move as well..keep your mouse on the softer side of pad due to the “fast/plastic” side will eat through your mouse’s lens and legs..:) just a tip
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mouse pad for sure
customer_reviews.text: Good wrist support, good control, good surface area. And I didn't think V1 could get any better but it has with V2. Quality product right here. I'm so much more accurate with this thing. Use razer synapse with this, take the time to get everything calibrated to how you like it and it will pay off big time. This is a must have for any gamer
customer_reviews.author: Smelly

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I went without a mouse pad for so long. This Razer one is premium. You have two sides, one smooth and one more sandpaperish to allow for fine controls. The wrist rest is nice. It's big and stays well in place. Highly recommended. I also have the Razer Naga which is an awesome mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Rated R Cars

customer_reviews.title: Still Good
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Vespula, and after years it started to get discolored, and nasty. I just bought it for the wrist rest part, because it fits perfectly under my Logitech wireless charging pad. I like this version 2, because of the longer padding. I bought it used like new to save a few bucks, and if I see it for cheap I might buy a spare.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product. Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Exactly what I have come to expect from Razer (Minus the palm pad coming off on my Orbweaver, but I digress). This is my second Razer dual hard surface pad. The last one lasted me 2 years and I'm a daily gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Deuel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse pad with space and comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I have big hands and big wrists, so comfort and space to move a mouse are important to me. This Vespula v2 is exactly what I needed. The memory foam wrist rest is very comfortable for me and the surface is large and responsive. The mouse glides across it very easily and is right on point in any game I play. Very happy with this and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: An Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good mousepad. Holds onto dirt/dust
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose. Big mousepad for gaming with 3 different surface choices. Gets dirty easy, really holds onto dust and crumbs. Also it is in two parts so sometimes they might not line up but not a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nate T

customer_reviews.title: it's ok but it could have been so much better
customer_reviews.text: After getting the keyboard wrist rest i thought this one would be just as good. I was wrong. The wrist rest is so small. I wish that it was thicker. If it was basically a smaller version of the keyboard wrist rest with the excellent mouse pad attached it would be five stars. Till then at best it's 3.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kennedy Jr

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble with my wrists while I was gaming. This help tremendously. It's big enough to have plenty of room to move the mouse around. The wrist pad is super comfy, it's easy to clean, and it's held up really well. Definitely recommend this to anybody with wrist pain from computer use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great gamer mouse pad but large and one side is difficult to maintain clean
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the vespula v1 and always loved these gamer mouse pads. This is just as good but it is much larger so make sure you have the room. The only other downside is the one side with a felt material is not easy to clean and everything sticks to it. I keep it on the smooth hard surface the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Dad's Dojo

customer_reviews.title: Get a real mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up with a Taipan and no matter what their own support tried, with their own software, it will not allow the mouse to work on the soft side, just the hard "speed" side as they call it. A Amazon brand cheap mouse pad worked better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing; larger than most wrist wrests
customer_reviews.text: I really love this item; I had some older gaming mouse pads with wrist support that are no longer made; so I was bummed out until I found this one. Works great, not too bad of a price. Do not hesitate to get one
customer_reviews.author: Daddy to Cora, Elliot and Griffin, Rowen, and Willow!

customer_reviews.title: does its job
customer_reviews.text: Hey what can I say, I paid $50 for a piece of plastic and foam. However, I ain't complaining. better than the last version, bigger, full wrist pad. No complaints, works as well as a mousepad can. I should get into this business.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle X. Hourihan

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: I have the first version and I always thought it was weird that it wasn't square. Good to see they not only made this square, but also made the gel padding better and much wider as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: One of the very ergonomic gaming mouse pads.
customer_reviews.text: I need this for maintaining ergonomics, Its one of the few gaming mouse pads with a decent quality wrist support. I could change two things? 1) Offer a larger size 2) The cloth backing is a bother if you have to move it.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm starting to game more on my computer so I had gotten this and I wasn't disappointed! It's very comfortable and the wrist support works really well. My wrist doesn't hurt after a few minutes, so I'm able to have longer and more comfortable gaming sessions. Really the only bad thing is the size. It's too big but it's my fault for not really looking at the measurements. 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Iyananana

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the Vespula Version 1 which I bought 8 or 9 years ago. Still worked great and in great condition with pretty much daily use since buying. I like the longer wrist rest and the darker coloring of the Version 2. Works great. Very happy with the upgrade. I was just upgrading my complete set up when I came across this. Very happy I did. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MDN

customer_reviews.title: Best mousepad I've used
customer_reviews.text: This is the right combination of features. It has held up well for 2 years as of this review. The wrist cushion is the perfect size and softness. The size of the pad is excellent for real work. The design is demure and professional. It stays put on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Malcovitch Malcovitch

customer_reviews.title: Larger but not better than V1
customer_reviews.text: Pros: More surface area than V1; Cloth side and polymer side; clean look Cons: wrist pad could be maybe another half or full inch wrist length, the pad slips on laminate or coated desk gets annoying in fps games when I have to constantly reset the entire mouse pad because it is hanging off the desk. never had this issue with the v1
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Better than previous version
customer_reviews.text: It's great! I own its predecessor, so I knew it was double sided, but didn't expect one side to be fuzzy, lol. Looking forward to using that on a game where I need the tighter control. Good job.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Mouse pad is better than V1, but...
customer_reviews.text: Mouse pad is better than V1, but the base with the first rest doesn't hold as well as my original vespula. Other than that, well worth the investment. Literally the only Razer product I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: R-Dub

customer_reviews.title: Great for e-sports
customer_reviews.text: It's got a bigger surface area than the last gen, bigger and more comfortable wrist rest, the speed surface has texture in it this time, so it tracks better on that surface. The control surface this time around has this velvet finish, that brakes mouse movement a little bit, but it does improve control without being too rough on your mouse feet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrés Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Consider open box if possible.
customer_reviews.text: I got mines open box for $20 or so, can’t beat it! A very good surface area for a mouse. I’ve been using the cloth side mainly since I’ve gotten it and no complaints! Looks like it’ll hold up for awhile. I ended up putting the wrist rest under my Turret keyboard and it’s a match made in heaven. It makes the combo much more optimized. Also nothing moves!
customer_reviews.author: Bdot

customer_reviews.title: Great but it slides
customer_reviews.text: Works relatively great. The only issue I have is that because it is not all one piece, the mouse pad itself slides relative to the wrist rest. This makes me have to move it back in place frequently. If that were fixed, I’d definitely give it a 5 star. Also, the surface of my desk is wooden. Just I. Case anyone was wondering what surface it’s moving like this on.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Work well - especially if you have more than 1 mouse
customer_reviews.text: Large and durable - great for 2 "mice". Only minor issue is the writst support is a bit firm.
customer_reviews.author: Allen W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mousepad!
customer_reviews.text: Great mousepad I had the other version as well but this one is more comfortable, it is large though!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love that i can switch in between the two surfaces. I use the harder surface more though. So far 1 month in, the wrist pad is not drooping, its still in the shape it came in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fairly sad
customer_reviews.text: I really like the mouse pad but sadly the durability seems lacking. Particularly the fabric on the wrist pad has started separating from the pad where my wrist rests.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M Buckley

customer_reviews.text: Build quality is good, I really like this mouse pad. Only problem I’ve had with it, is that the little letters on the wrist pad rub off pretty quickly. It doesn’t leave any marks behind and you can’t even tell it had letters on it so it’s not that big of a deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Allen Berends

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming or just chilling
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was in good shape when I got it and it came with two stickers of the logo which is really cool. The textures are really nice and worth every penny. The comfort side is soft and easy to move the mouse of and the speed side is faster than the other side so it’s easy to play shooter games. The rist rest is very cushiony and very comfortable. Plus it was a lot bigger than I was expecting!
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie Decker

customer_reviews.title: I have the old version of years, now it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the old version of years, now it's time for development, just wait for the price to drop to $ 32 and I'll buy it again for me.
customer_reviews.author: alfaify

customer_reviews.title: Decent mat at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: If you use a claw or fingertips grip, the height of the wrist rest should perfect. For those that like a palm grip stay away. The only complaint I have is that the cloth side uses a microfiber type material that tends to wear out faster than woven cloth mats like the goliathus I have
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Had the 1st gen, now loving the 2nd.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's a great product, you wont be disappointed, no slipping and is of better build than the 1st gen
customer_reviews.author: Brian Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line
customer_reviews.text: Everything you want in a mousepad and more :) I used the Vespula v1 for years before I decided I needed a replacement, and was super stoked to find out that they made a V2. Top of the line mousepad. Sleek and sexy.
customer_reviews.author: Cory See

customer_reviews.title: Less pain is always a good thing!
customer_reviews.text: The sizing, the cushioning, the flexibility make this mouse pad well worth every penny spent.
customer_reviews.author: agd

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse pad I ever used
customer_reviews.text: Been using this mouse pad for 2 years and it’s amazing
customer_reviews.author: Rami

customer_reviews.title: Don't think twice!
customer_reviews.text: The first version was meh. This one sure knocked it out of the park!! A fabric like side, and a hard material side on the mouse pad. Cannot beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Kulcher

customer_reviews.title: over all good
customer_reviews.text: over all good set back, its a 2 pieces thing, and very hard to move around
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: perfect mat
customer_reviews.text: was looking for a mousemat with an attached wrist rest. I like the hard surface on this one, my razer naga wireless glides over it better than a soft mat. It's also very easy to clean with just a wet paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad a bit overprised though.
customer_reviews.text: Probibly the best mouse pad you can get. Problem is you pay the razer brand tax for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great pad.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the pad is not on synaps 3. You can still tune your mouse to the pad using synaps. The wrist foam is fantastic and great for long secions
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: It’s gud
customer_reviews.text: It’s freaking worth it and the size of the wrist resting pad is nice soft and cushy while the double sided excels in the mouse speed you want and sensitivity easily switchable and to use well for your liking
customer_reviews.author: Johnson L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use in the bed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for using while in bed which is how I use it. If you're looking for a stiff mouse pad to use in bed, this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: TheUsedVersion

customer_reviews.title: Typical Razer product
customer_reviews.text: My desk has a ridge that was annoying. This pad fixed that issue and the fact the mat has 2 sides to choose from just adds to the value.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: good service and good quality product. THe pad is perfect, not too stiff and he double sided hard/ soft surface works great!
customer_reviews.author: Karl Wong

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth and comfortable two great surfaces changed up from last gen I really like the fabric side in this one a little big but perfect size for in my opinion no sliding was a little pricy but worth the investment to have a amazing mousepad with a perfect wrist pad to keep your wrist from digging in
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Coghlan

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for your money
customer_reviews.text: Started to fall apart at the ends in less then 3 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: 2.0 great
customer_reviews.text: Larger and more comfortable than the first version and the pad doesn’t move around like with the first version
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Too Firm!!
customer_reviews.text: Wrist rest is to firm, after long periods it can actually cause discomfort. It needs to be softer like silicone in those boob mouse pads.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Slightly misses the mark.
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, although the only complaint I have is the wrist rest is a bit too large and tall and can leave part of your arm/wrist just hanging depending on your setup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wrist wrest is way to high
customer_reviews.text: the wrist wrest is so big that it hurts my wrist if it was lower I would use it
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: My favorite gaming pad to date
customer_reviews.text: Love it, replaced the older model with this one, probably getting another for my 2nd PC
customer_reviews.author: Chris Witt

customer_reviews.title: Premium Product Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a premium product at a great price! Having the two surface options is very nice and it is extremely durable!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Bad value
customer_reviews.text: The surface of the pad is decent and it's a good size. However, the hand rest pad is stiff and not comfortable over long playtime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: nothing special, the grip on the surface its not great, and the product it self is quite expensive for what they offer.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto T.

customer_reviews.title: this foam is amazing
customer_reviews.text: best mouse surface i have ever seen...the memory foam saved me so much wrist pain
customer_reviews.author: Gal

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: super smooth, looks great on the desk and feels great. well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and makes reliable smooth movements with my mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Stallbaumer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best gaming mouse pad ever. razer makes some amazing products
customer_reviews.author: Noel Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: it's a 2 piece mouse pad and the top slides around and gets out of place.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk.... Mouse ...
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk.... Mouse pad feet came off it and slides everywhere and is plastic..... Not worth anywhere near 40 bucks. STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: Savy

customer_reviews.title: If you're worked about your wrists this is a great option
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and spend most of the say sitting at my desk. I felt the strain starting to take a toll on my wrists and knew I needed to do something about it. I had been using an older Razer metal mousepad which provided no wrist support. This elevates my wrist, is super comfortable, and the build quality is solid!
customer_reviews.author: David Wixom

product_meta.title: Razer Vespula V2: Dual-Sided Surface - Optimized Form Factor - Improved Memory Foam Wrist Rest - Hard and Cloth Gaming Mouse Pad
product_meta.description: Improved from its predecessor, the Razer vespula V2 is a dual-sided mouse mat that comes with a greater surface area, enhanced tracking surfaces, and a larger wrist rest, so you get the best of versatility and comfort, all in one.
feature_bullets: Improved from its predecessor, the Razer Vespula V2 is a dual sided mouse mat that comes with a greater surface area, enhanced tracking surfaces, and a larger wrist rest, so you get the best of versatility and comfort, all in one

Featuring a larger gaming surface than its predecessor, the Razer Vespula V2 is optimized for even more playstyles. Now you can execute large swift movements or multiple commands across the entire map without any interruptions
Whether you need more stopping power for those head shots or more glide to pursue your opponents, each side of the Razer Vespula V2 is engineered to meet your specific needs
Fine tuned to your needs, the height and feel of the wrist rest have been improved so you get even more comfort and support to keep going during those intense gaming marathons

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars239 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
